data.title: Members - The Trapani Lab at Amherst College
data.snippet:
#### Ha Dong '26

'26 Neuroscience Thesis Student  
 Former Lab Research Student  
 Ha is a senior from Hanoi, Vietnam, tri-majoring in Physics, Mathematics, and Neuroscience. Ha is interested in how different sensory modalities shape behaviors and plans to pursue a Ph.D. degree. Outside the lab, Ha works with the Center for Teaching and Learning and the Strategic Learning Center to help improve the teaching and learning on campus. In his free time, you would find him taking photographs or biking along the Norwottuck Rail Trail, trying out new coffee recipes, or jamming with friends with his cajon. Learn more about him here: 

#### Shirley Fu '26 [...] #### Allie Platt '26

'26 Neuroscience Thesis Student  
 Allie Platt (she/her) is a senior from Brooklyn, New York. She is majoring in neuroscience on the pre-med track. Outside the lab, she is co-founder and co-president of the figure skating club, an EMT on ACEMS, and a Peer Educator. In her free time, she loves to listen to music (tune in to Hyperfixstation on WAMH), explore a new coffee shop, and travel.

#### Ha Dong '26 [...] #### Yaa Obeng '22

Former Lab Research Student  
 Former Summer SURF Student  
 Yaa is a senior from Newark, New Jersey. She is a Neuroscience major and is also on the pre-med track. Her interest in research began in summer 2018 in the Que Lab at Columbia University where she conducted research on lung regeneration. The next summer, Yaa later went on to work on an international Neuroblastoma project in a biostatistics lab affiliated with Harvard Medical School and Dana-Farber/Boston Children's Cancer and Blood Disorders Center. Outside of research, Yaa is a Pad Thai connoisseur, enjoys watching movies and learning new language, and misses throwing hammer on the Amherst Track & Field team.

#### Hannah Neiditz '21

data.title: Experiential Learning | Academics - Amherst College
data.snippet:
Skip to primary navigation
 Skip to section menu
 Skip to footer

Amherst College

Amherst College

Menu   Tools

# Experiential Learning

## Section Navigation

We set our students and graduates on a path to be engaged, effective, and innovative problem-solvers in their communities and workplaces. We support learning, inquiry, and action — inside and outside of the curriculum, via many avenues:

 undergraduate research
 laboratory and field experiences
 courses that involve community work
 study abroad
 internships and fellowships
 capstone projects
 creative endeavors
 involvement in student organizations

## Career Exploration [...] Public Speaking

## Makerspaces

Our collaborative workspaces have tools and resources to support every kind of innovative endeavor — entrepreneurial, artistic, scholarly, civic, or all the above. Work with friends or independently.

Find MakerSpaces [...] ## Research

Amherst students work side-by-side with professors conducting important research. We provide opportunities during the school year and the summer, both paid and unpaid, and offer funding for theses.

Student-Faculty Research

### SURF Program

The Summer Science Undergraduate Research Fellowship (SURF) is an eight-to-10-week program on the Amherst College campus focusing on research in scientific, statistical, and mathematical fields.

More about SUrF

### Financial Support for Internships

To ensure that students have opportunities for professional growth, Amherst uses funds provided by alumni and others to funnel about $1 million per year into connecting students with internships and giving financial support when needed.

Supporting Summer Interns
